message.content:
cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

The paper discusses the study of polar codes in fading channels, which is a topic related to information theory and communication systems. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.COMM (Communications and Networking) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the construction and implementation of polar codes, which falls under the category of coding theory, making cs.CC (Computational Complexity) a likely sub-category as well. The paper proposes a new method for pilot selection, which is related to signal processing and system identification, making cs.SI (Signal Processing) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the performance of the proposed method in simulations, which is related to networked systems and protocols, making cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) a possible sub-category.
